item.title: New PS5 Rental Programs Emerge In Some Regions, And It's Already Super Popular In Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/new-ps5-rental-programs-emerge-in-some-regions-and-its-already-super-popular-in-japan/1100-6529939/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

Sony is now allowing users in the UK and Japan to rent PS5, PlayStation VR 2, and PlayStation Portal devices. In the UK, Sony has partnered with leasing company Raylo for this, with plans covering 12-, 24-, and 36-month terms.

Plans start at Â£11/month for the PS5 digital slim model with a 36-month lease, and scale up from there for shorter lease durations. Leasing a PS5 Pro, meanwhile, starts at Â£19/month for 36 months, scaling up to Â£27/month for a 12-month lease. Sony also offers monthly rolling leases that allow players to cancel any time, but these are considerably more expensive (Â£36/month for the PS5 Pro).

This doesn't appear to be a rent-to-own program. The leasing website states that, "Your lease ends when you return your device, after your chosen lease term."

People can also rent the PSVR 2 starting at Â£18.50/month for a 36-month lease, the PlayStation Portal for Â£6.50/month over 36 months, and a DualSense Edge controller for Â£7.50/month over 36 months.

Raylo offers a "fair wear and tear policy" that states users can return a device with "obvious signs of use," including deep scratches, small dents, and discoloration. However, cracks, significant cosmetic damage, and functional faults are outside of the policy and could result in charges.

If you're interested in leasing a PlayStation device with Raylo, you can visit the leasing website to learn more and place an order.

A similar leasing program is available in Japan. It's proving to be very popular there, apparently, with Automaton reporting that rental allocation has already reached capacity. As of yet, however, there is no word on if the rental program will come to the US.

Many years ago, Microsoft announced Xbox All Access, a program that allowed players in the US to buy an Xbox and pay for it on a monthly schedule similar to a smartphone plan. The service appears to have been discontinued or scaled back in the US but is still available in New Zealand.

The PS5 Pro, priced at $700 USD, is among the most expensive video game consoles ever. It's not aimed at regular players, however, as Sony is instead targeting hardcore users who don't care very much about price.

Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra doesn't have an official release date or even window yet beyond "2025," but according to one of the game's voice actors, we could be playing it by the end of the year.

The game's Black Panther voice actor, Khary Payton, told The Direct, "Weâ€™re still working. Weâ€™re planning on 2025. Weâ€™re thinking like a Christmas situation. But I'm so excited." While the game seemingly already had a 2025 release window, Payton's comment at least narrows down a potential launch month.

While December might be an odd time to release a game, some big ones have released during that month. These include games like Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, The Callisto Protocol, Marvel's Midnight Suns, and Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora.

Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra follows Captain America and Black Panther has them take on the Axis powers of Nazi Germany. It'll feature an original World War II story set in Paris, France, as players control four heroes, the other two of whom are Howling Commandos member Gabriel Jones and Nanali, the leader of the Wakandan spy network.

There will also be other supporting characters, such as Howard Stark as well as a new original character named Julie, who is an ally to the French Resistance against Hydra and Nazis.

Marvel 1943 is being developed in Unreal Engine 5 over at developer Skydance New Media, with producers Amy Hennig and Julian Beak at the helm.

item.title: Stalker 2 Passes Huge New Player Milestone, Dev Says It's "Hard To Comprehend"
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/stalker-2-passes-huge-new-player-milestone-dev-says-its-hard-to-comprehend/1100-6529937/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GSC Game World has announced that Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl has surpassed a new player milestone. The Game Pass game has now eclipsed 6 million players since it launched in November 2024.

The studio said reaching this many players is "hard to comprehend." After all, Stalker 2 has had a tumultuous development, having been canceled in 2012, then revived, then delayed as the studio made the game as Russian invaded Ukraine.

"We are incredibly grateful and proud that each of you has left a unique mark in the Zone," the studio said.

Stalker 2 sold more than 1 million copies across PC and Xbox after just 24 hours back in November 2024. That doesn't tell the entire story of how many people have played it, though, as GSC has said many more people have played the game via Game Pass. Stalker 2 was a day-one launch on Game Pass.

While some Xbox games eventually come to PS5, GSC has not said if Stalker 2 will head to Sony's console as of yet.
